newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot LPGs soar on strong crude, tight stocks.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot LPGs soar on strong crude, tight stocks.

text.p: U.S. spot LPG prices rose sharply on Wednesday, sparked by rising crude oil prices and tight stocks, industry sources said.
Strength on crude oil markets, inspired by tensions in Iraq, helped boosted LPG prices at both centers by about one cent a gallon from Tuesday.
Tight stocks remain at the heart of the liquids market bullishness, they noted
Propane at Mont Belvieu firmed to 46.75 cents a gallon at Mont Belvieu, with some offeres heard as high as 47 cents.
Purity ethane there rose to 30.75 cents and deals were reportedly done on E-P mix at 29.75 cents.
At Conway, Kansas, propane jumped to 44.50 cents a gallon.
Most butanes at both centers also firmed, traders said.
-- Franklin Paul, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1620
